page.title: 01UFFORD VILLAGE AND ENVIRONS
page.content: The block lies in the north-west tip of cambridgeshire and is predominantly limestone country, evidence by fine traditional stone buildings and remains of old quarries. Just west of centre is Ufford village and from its highest point the land falls away to the north and east where the flatness suggests the nearby fens. The eastern half of the area is also punctuated by several deciduous which stand amidst large fields created by the removal of hedges in recent years. These woods and a large coniferous plantation on the southern boundary house deer and game-birds. It is an agricultural area, mainly arable but with some cattle, sheep and poultry. The majority of workers, however, travel to Peterborough and Stamford and most modern residential development has attracted the professional middle-
